clinical_study.brief_title: Rehabilitation of Athletes With Knee Osteochondral Injuries
clinical_study.official_title: Examination and Post-operative Rehabilitation of University Athletes With Osteochondral Lesions of the Knee: A Case Series Report

brief_summary.textblock: A case-series review was performed on five collegiate athletes with osteochondral lesions of the knee at California State University, Northridge (CSUN). All subjects received surgical intervention to treat the defect. The surgeries performed were either an Osteoarticular Transfer System (OATS) procedure and/or a Microfracturing procedure. Subjects were treated post-operatively by the CSUN team physical therapist and/or athletic trainers at CSUN. This paper seeks to provide information about osteochondral defects of the knee, the surgical interventions, and a protocol for post-operative treatment and rehabilitation of such injuries.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion; an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Determined by subject's ability to return to play of his/her respective sport

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Monthly until the completion of the study; an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Pain as measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS), 0 (No pain) - 10 (Severe Pain)

study_pop.textblock: The subjects were recruited from a population of student athletes at California State University, Northridge. These athletes were being treated by the Physical Therapy and/or Athletic Training Departments for Osteochondral Defect of the knee.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Student athlete at CSUN
- Diagnosed with Osteochondral dissecans (OCD)
- Underwent surgical procedure to treat OCD
- Treated postoperatively by the team physical therapist and/or athletic trainers at CSUN.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No concurrent ligamentous injures to the knee during the time of subject participation in the study
